content.question: Although Jan van Eyck’s Arnolfini Portrait has traditionally been interpreted as representing a wedding, the painting has more recently been interpreted as representing a

choices.label: betrothal ceremony between a wealthy merchant and his future bride
ritual marking a young woman’s entry into a convent
family portrait of a father and a daughter in a domestic interior
biblical story regarding the Virgin Mary’s presentation at the temple

content.answer: betrothal ceremony between a wealthy merchant and his future bride

unit.text: 3: Early Europe and Colonial Americas, 200 - 1750 CE

topic.text: 3.5: Theories and Interpretations of Early European and Colonial American Art

skill.text: Skill 7.A: Describe one or more art historically relevant interpretations of a work of art (or group of related works of art), its reception, or its meaning.
